basics.name: C.M. (Kees) Nederhoff, Ph.D.
basics.label: Coastal Scientist | Natural Hazard and Risk Engineering
basics.summary: Coastal scientist specializing in compound flooding, sea-level rise, and probabilistic tropical cyclone forecasting. Leads applied and federal research at Deltares USA and USGS to improve coastal hazard predictions and nature-based resilience.

work.name: Deltares USA
work.summary: Lead scientist on coastal hydrodynamics, morphodynamics, and coastal & riverine hazard projects.

work.name: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
work.summary: Co-led development of nationwide compound flooding capabilities in USGS CoSMoS and integrated coastal–riverine–groundwater modeling approaches for urban estuaries.

work.name: Stichting Deltares Netherlands
work.summary: Developed Delft3D, XBeach, SEAWAT, and compound flood modeling applications; guest lecturer in MSc coastal modeling.

education.summary: "Navigating the Storm: New Approaches to Tropical Cyclone Risk Analysis"

publications.name: Mitigating Flood Risks in Urban Estuaries
publications.publisher: Journal of Waterway, Port, Coastal, and Ocean Engineering
